question: Which state will get international educational institution for minorities recently?
explanation: Union Minister of Minority Affairs, Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has stated that an international educational institution for minorities will be built in Rajasthan's Alwar city. The institute in Alwar, will be one of the five such institutes, which the Central Government is planning to set up across India. The plan for building international educational institution for minorities was initially prepared in 2016 and an 11-member committee was formed under former bureaucrat Afzal Amanullah to oversee it.
